glossary.title: Glossary
glossary.subtitle: Legal Terms
glossary.description: Collection of legal terms used in Indonesia.

meta.description: Explore a comprehensive collection of legal terms commonly used in Indonesian legal practice.

pt.title: Limited Liability Company (PT)
pt.definition: A legal entity that is a capital partnership, established based on an agreement between 2 or more people and conducts business activities with authorized capital that is entirely divided into shares

tbk.title: Public Company (Tbk)
tbk.definition: A legal entity that has conducted an IPO so that its shares can be bought and owned by the public

bumn.title: State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN)
bumn.definition: A company whose shares are mostly or entirely owned by the State, and all profits are considered as State income, as well as losses which are considered as State losses

perjan.title: Public Service Company (Perjan)
perjan.definition: A State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN) that operates in the field of public service provision and its business activities do not prioritize profit

perum.title: Public Corporation (Perum)
perum.definition: A State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN) that operates in the field of public benefit services

persero.title: State-Owned Corporation (Persero)
persero.definition: A State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN) that operates in the private and cooperative sectors and is prioritized in business activities to gain profit

rups.title: General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS)
rups.definition: One of the company's organs that has the highest authority in a company, consisting of Regular (Annual) GMS and Extraordinary GMS

merger.title: Merger
merger.definition: A legal action taken by one or more companies to merge with another existing company, resulting in the merging company being dissolved
merger.example: The merger between Gojek and Tokopedia in 2021 forming GoTo Group. In this process, both companies combined their operations, assets, and organizational structures into a new entity.
